I'm working on getting things set up to start working on podium interactions. We have a meeting scheduled this afternoon to dive in on that.
Coming in from an appointment. Should be in in 15
library!

As far as how the data fits into the display for layout, I wrote down some ideas how it would work based on our meeting friday. The idea of a display being the full width of the 4 screens, with each screen being a panel in the system. And panels having a slot template assigned to them. These slot templates have a dictation of sections in them for putting the data into. So content in the system would have a panel and slot id for placement. Panels being like A B C D and slots being 1 2 3 4. So an image could be in A1 and it would be centered within this slot on that panel. Other styling could be attached through css styling based on the content type or some override. This would allow for the layout managment as we had discussed friday, with the admin being able to select a different layout on each of the panels withint the displays in the system. I have notes mapping out how I would make this all work within the software architecture.

That is representative of one of the displays, a display being one of the groupings, there would be 3 of these displays in this app, with the podium being its own display and app, and by app I'm referring to the angular app

this is a break down of how one of these displays would work, the others work just the same, they would just have less panels in them. the grouping to the left has 3, and the other group split into the two landscape have 2

right and following the map they are numbered 1 -3 and podium being 4. for the id of the display clusters, this follows thru with how it will actually be rendered since each cluster is technically one large browser instance aka a display, that is logically broken down into the panels on it one for each physical monitor
